remarks:
2009-Jun-02 09:47:57 by psilord:
Assigned to Nick since it looks like it is in code he understands very well.

2009-Jun-10 12:56:41 by nleroy:
I think that this was caused by daemonCore->InfoCommandSinfulString() returning a NULL which was dereferenced in the initialization code. That's the only scenarios that I've been able to come up with that would cause this stack trace. Notice the 'Command Socket at <0.0.0.0:53795>' in the above trace... Looks mighty suspicious to me.
check_ins: 2009-Jun-10 12:54   Check-in [14870]: Fixed a bug that could cause the startd to seg fault in the network adaptor code if initialized with a NULL sinful/name string (#461) (By Nick LeRoy )
